properties.title: Ancient India
properties.description:
Leeching is practiced as a form of bloodletting. Leeches, which are sometimes called blood suckers, are worm-like creatures that suck out blood when applied to the skin. Leeches remained a common therapy into the 20th century before being phased out, but they make a comeback in the 1980s to help blood flow after microsurgery.

Indian scholars also write lengthy descriptions of the healing power of spices and herbs.
